snippet: Under a proposal, the Food and Drug Administration would shift from taking action after contamination occurred to requiring measures to prevent it in the first place.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration proposes two sweeping rules aimed at preventing the contamination of produce and processed foods; proposals represent sea change in the way agency polices food, moving from a reactionary to a more pro-active model.
lead_paragraph: Under a proposal, the Food and Drug Administration would shift from taking action after contamination occurred to requiring measures to prevent it in the first place.

headline.seo: F.D.A. Offers Rules to Stop Food Contamination
headline.main: F.D.A. Offers Broad New Rules to Fight Food Contamination
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Proposes Broad New Rules On Food Safety
